materials.raw_text:
Lithium carbonate (Li2CO3) - 4.5 g 
 Yttrium oxide (Y2O3) - 6.0 g 
 Zinc oxide (ZnO) - 10.0 g 
 Zinc carbonate (ZnCO3) - 5.0 g 
 Binder (polyvinyl alcohol, PVA) - 3.0 g 
 Deionized water - 30.0 g

sourcing.instructions:
Lithium carbonate can be obtained from chemical supply companies or online specialty retailers. 
 Yttrium oxide is available from chemical suppliers or materials science vendors. 
 Zinc oxide and zinc carbonate are found at chemical supply stores or online. 
 Polyvinyl alcohol can be sourced from craft stores or chemical suppliers. 
 Deionized water can be acquired from laboratory supply stores or produced using a water purification system.

preparation.raw_text:
1. Weigh out 4.5 g of lithium carbonate, 6.0 g of yttrium oxide, 10.0 g of zinc oxide, and 5.0 g of zinc carbonate. 
 2. In a clean mixing container, combine the dry powders. 
 3. In a separate container, dissolve 3.0 g of polyvinyl alcohol in 30.0 g of deionized water while stirring until fully dissolved. 
 4. Gradually add the binder solution to the dry powder mixture while stirring continuously to ensure uniform mixing.
